page.title: 07Farming
page.content: MR Haynes runs Lower Lodge Farm. It is a mixed farm growing wheat, oats and barley and he rears bullocks and sheep. He does not own his land and farm he rents it. Boughton leigh estate owns 280 acres of land and MR Haynes rents 7. When he rented his land it used to be Â£10 now it is Â£50. He owns 3 tractors, combien harvester, bayler, plough, drill, harrow and lots other machinery. He works from 7am till 1pm and then from 2pm till 6pm sometimes till midnight. He likes where his farm is situated because he is near to the Rugby cattle market. He likes being his own boss and being in the country. He produces 120 ton of wheat, 60 ton of oats and 60 ton of barley in a year. MR Haynes does farming to make a living not a profit.
